hacking.notes: 'Abuse of functionality' covers the Abuse of the password recovery flow (WASC mentions this specifically as an example of this attack class: http://projects.webappsec.org/w/page/13246913/Abuse%20of%20Functionality). Not sure what method was used to exploit the server vuln.

external.notes: attackers are the same ones who managed to hack GigaDice, another Bitcoin service a month earlier.

asset.notes: Following enumerations present before veris 1.3.3 removed: asset.governance.Personally owned.

confidentiality.notes: Not sure what data variety fits with Bitcoins, so going with 'other'

integrity.notes: The attackers hacked the hosting account by compromising some old email accounts. The cybercriminals could easily reset their passwords because there were no phone numbers attached to the accounts.

impact.notes: approx value of Bitcoins at time of hack.;

summary: Inputs.io, a "high-security" bitcoin web wallet and a Bitcoin Foundation silver member, has been hacked with total of 4100 BTC siphoned off. The secure web wallet has revealed that it is not in a position to pay all user balances.
